Arthur Rahimov

Strikepro

Role

Backend developer

Type

Catalog

Description

The Strike Pro website serves as the digital hub for one of the world’s premier fishing tackle brands. Established in 1973, Strike Pro has evolved from a small producer on Taiwan's shores to a leading name in the global fishing community. The website highlights their extensive product line, including precision-engineered lures, soft baits, and fishing accessories, all designed for both amateur and professional anglers. Each product is crafted with meticulous attention to detail, ensuring superior performance and durability.

Stack

  • PHP
  • Laravel
  • MySQL
  • 1C
  • Monorepo
  • API
  • RESTful
  • Git
  • Swagger
  • OpenAPI
  • JavaScript
  • Bash
  • CI/CD
  • TypeORM
  • Markdown

Responsibilities

  • Developed backend functionality for a project from the ground up using the Laravel framework.
  • Collaborated closely with the frontend developer to ensure seamless integration and functionality.
  • Designed and implemented RESTful APIs for the administrator panel to manage backend operations and data flow efficiently.
  • Engaged indirectly in the frontend development process, providing support and ensuring integration compatibility with the backend system.
  • Configured Docker environments to create consistent development and production setups, enhancing deployment efficiency and system stability.
  • Gathered detailed project requirements and formulated technical specifications for both backend and frontend development teams.
  • Integrated the system with the 1C enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, enabling smooth data exchange and process automation.
  • Implemented data import and export functionalities to and from the 1C system, ensuring accurate and reliable data transfer.
  • Designed and structured the database architecture to support scalable and efficient data management and retrieval processes.
  • Established Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) pipelines for both backend and frontend, automating the build, test, and deployment processes.
Date of Implementation: 24.01.2024
